Dear Shade — if injur'd Spirits wander near</br>The cold Couch where their Victim-forms recline,</br>Oh come at ev'nings twilight hour, and hear</br>And breathe thy last farewell to me on thine—</br>For here I sit and think at day's decline—</br>Thy early bloom — sweet hours — for ever gone—</br>So mild — so tender — e'er thou did'st resign</br>Thy whole heart up to Passion's thrill alone—</br>All lov'd and mourn thee, hapless youth, save one.

And she was all to thee — till thou to her</br>Wert mock'ry's sport — so sad and so subdued—</br>As wanton winds the stealing lock bestir,</br>She took and toss'd thee from her bosom rude—</br>The reel of triumph met the eye that woo'd—</br>Ungentle Conqu'rer, when the prize was won,</br>To break the bruis'd reed! — 'twas then we view'd</br>Thy gentleness — thy reason — all undone—</br>All mourn — for all did love thee — all — save one!</br>
